definition:
Given a $S$ with two binary operations $+\colon S \times S \to S$ and
$\cdot\colon S \times S \to S$, we say that $\cdot$ is [*right
distributive*]{} over $+$ if
$$(a+b) \cdot c = (a \cdot c) + (b \cdot c)\mathrm{~for~all~} a,b,c \in S$$
and [*left distributive*]{} over $+$ if
$$a \cdot (b+c) = (a \cdot b) + (a \cdot c)\mathrm{~for~all~}a,b,c \in S.$$
If $\cdot$ is both left and right distributive over $+$, then it is said
to be [*distributive*]{} over $+$ (or, alternatively, we may say that
$\cdot$ [*distributes over*]{} $+$).
